name: Common information
info:
# help + Init

**help + Init** contains some basic help information (like this) and some global pre-configurations, like a list of OI4-defined DataSetClassIds.


# test
**test** contains some test and monitor flows to use during evaluation.


# OEC GW
**OEC GW** simulates a 'host service' belonging to the used Edge Gateway. It provides the Edge Device representation in the Message Bus.
To do so, the **OEC GW** is represented through an own MQTT Client. The related configuration Node is called 'OEC-GW-MQTT-Client'.
> In case your Edge Device already provides an OI4 conform representation on the Message Bus, just disable the register **OEC GW**.


# MyApp
**MyApp** represents an OI4 conform application - in this case something like a protocol adapter (serviceType = OTConnector). 

**MyApp**, with the oi4Identifier created in function node `MyApp/init`, is the publischer from its own messages and of any messages provided from any detected devices (e.g. **MyDevice**). 
Therefore the `PublisherId` always contains the `oi4Identifier` from the application.


# MyDevice
**MyDevice** emulates a device which was detected from **MyApp**.
Indeed the application detected "some how" a device, found out what Master Asset Model, etc. it has and provides this information to the Message Bus.

**MyDevice** can not publish straight to the message bus - but this is, what **MyApp** is made for.

**MyDevice** with the oi4Identifier created in function node `MyDevice/init` is the source of the device specific information.

> Remember, the `PublisherId` contains the `oi4Identifier` from the publisher, which is always **MyApp**.


# Difference between **explicit** and **summarized** NetworkMessages
In the registers **OEC GW**, **MyApp** and **MyDevice**, several `mqtt_in` nodes are configured to subscribe to explicite topics such as `oi4/<serviceType>/<appId>/get/<resource>/<subResource>/<filter>` and to summarized topics such as `oi4/<serviceType>/<appId>/get/<resource>`. Depending of the incomming topic, the `mqtt_out` nodes will be used to publish explicit or summarized information.

### Explicit
Explicite NetworkMessages containing only a "single information", e.g. only a specific mam or a specific health from a specific asset. Topics to explicit NetworkMessages containing a `<subResource>` and a `<filter>`.
In most cases a "single information" meant only one DataSetMessage is included. For some resources, such as publicationList, the `<filter>` filters a bunch of DataSetMessages of a specific kind.


### Summarized Networkmessage
Summarized NetworkMessages containing several DataSetMessages of the same resource. E.g. to provide all mam DataSetMessages, no `<filter>` is needed in topic.

name: Globl Settings (e.g. GUIDs, variales, etc.)
info:
The DataSetClassIDs, defined in OEC Development Guideline are prepared here for global usage in Node-RED.

Other global settings might be specified here as well.

name: Monitor MQTT connection state
info:
This tab and its flows might help to debug and understand the MQTT communication.

First see the connection state of the MQTT Client, communicating  to the MQTT Broker.

Later on, a bunch of filters are predefined to filter specific OI4 functionalities.

name: Mirror all OI4 related MQTT traffic
info: Switch on the filters (debug nodes), you want to monitor.

name: This is the OI4 representation of an OI4 complient Edge Device (Edge Gateway)
info:
This representation of a OEC Edge Device uses an own MQTT client and has no connection/interaction with the other flows like **MyApp** or **MyDevice**

If you want to use it in combination with AAS or other platforms in parallel, please change at least the serial number of the gateway to create a unique instance!
To do so change this:
 1. Change at least the serialnumber in mam. Go to function node called `init` to do so.
 2. Change at least the serialnumber in birth, disconnect and will message of the MQTT client. **Remember, it needs to be changed in topic and payload!**

> **Attention:** Birth, will and disconnect messages are not yet configured in MQTT Client settings!

------------------------------------------------------------ MyApp basics ------------------------------------------------------------
info:
**MyApp** represents an application container (in this case emulated through Node-RED). 
The Node-RED flow is responsable for all application based OI4 basic services such as health, license, mam, ...
In addition, the application might be some kind of protocol adapter or offers other micro services, which are not implemented here.

**MyApp** with the oi4Identifier created in function node `init`, is the publischer of all locally generated information. 
Therefore the `PublisherId` contains always the `oi4Identifier` of the application.

If you want to use it in combination with AAS or other platforms in parallel, please change at least the serial number of the application to create a unique instance!
To do so change this:
 1. Change at least the serialnumber in mam. Go to function node called `init` to do so.
 2. Change at least the serialnumber in birth, disconnect and will message of the MQTT client. **Remember, it needs to be changed in topic and payload!**

> **Attention:** Birth, will and disconnect messages are not yet configured in MQTT Client settings!

name: init
Initialization / ToDos
info: Initialize the application by configuring the global available name plate (aka MAM) and the oi4Identifier. Open the `init` node for this and change the content.

------------------------------------------------------------ MyDevice basics ------------------------------------------------------------
info:
**MyDevice** emulates a device which was detected from **MyApp**.
Indeed the application detected "some how" a device and found out what Master Asset Model, etc. it has.

**MyDevice** can not publish straight to the message bus - but this is, what **MyApp** is made for.

**MyApp** with the oi4Identifier created in function node `MyApp/init`, is the publischer of the the new detected device. 
Therefore the `PublisherId` is always the `oi4Identifier` from the application.

**MyDevice** with the oi4Identifier created in function node `MyDevice/init` is the source of the device specific values.

If you want to use it in combination with AAS or other platforms in parallel, please change at least the serial number of the device to create a unique instance!
To do so change this:
 1. Change at least the serialnumber in mam. Go to function node called `init` to do so.
 2. Other than for **MyApp**, no changes needed for serialnumber in birth, disconnect and will message of the MQTT client, because the device does not have its own MQTT client, it uses the one from **MyApp**.
